University of Hamburg

The University of Hamburg is one of the oldest and largest universities in Germany, offering a world-class education in a wide range of disciplines, including computer science and psychology. The Computer Science department, where my course of study Human-Computer Interaction was located, is renowned for its cutting-edge research and high-quality education programs.

Visit study program website

The bachelorʼs degree program in Human-Computer Interaction has a strong interdisciplinary orientation. It combines theoretical foundations from computer science and psychology with application-oriented topics from the fields of software development and multimedia systems. Basic study contents are:

  • Fundamentals of human-computer interaction
  • Development of computer science systems
  • Mathematical & theoretical foundations of computer science
  • Basics of psychology (general psychology, industrial and organizational psychology, social psychology)
  • Interaction design and usability
  • Specialized internships, projects and a bachelor thesis

October 2015 ➙ September 2020

My Projects at University of Hamburg

November 2019 ➙ September 2020

Investigating the Usability of Cookie Notices

Conducting an eye tracking study in an experimental setup to investigate the usability of common types of cookie notices, and designing a prototype for better usability.

User Research
UX Design
Web

October 2017 ➙ March 2018

Reducing Cyber Sickness in Virtual Reality

Investigating of the reduction of cyber sickness in virtual reality by introducing a fixed point (helicopter cockpit).

User Research
Virtual Reality
